data.title: Sestertius of Agrippina the Elder
data.meta_description:
Obverse: Head of Agrippina, bare, draped, right; beaded border. Reverse: Large S . C central with small dot and crescent interpunct; beaded border. 
This coin was issued under the authority of the Emperor Claudius for his sister-in-law Agrippina, wife of Germanicus, who died in 33 CE. Claudius later married Agrippina the Younger, who was his niece.
data.meta_site_name: Online Collection of the Walters Art Museum
data.text:
Obverse: Head of Agrippina, bare, draped, right; beaded border. Reverse: Large S . C central with small dot and crescent interpunct; beaded border.

This coin was issued under the authority of the Emperor Claudius for his sister-in-law Agrippina, wife of Germanicus, who died in 33 CE. Claudius later married Agrippina the Younger, who was his niece.

Inscription

Provenance

Provenance (from the French provenir, 'to come from/forth') is the chronology of the ownership, custody, or location of a historical object.

Harold Landon, Baltimore, [date and mode of acquisition unknown]; Walters Art Museum, 1943, by gift.
